In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for the function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string as input and performs the following operations:
1. It converts all characters to lower case using `lowercase`.
2. It removes leading and trailing whitespaces from the string using `strip`.
3. It replaces any spaces or hyphens with underscores using `replace` and a regular expression (`r"[\s-]+"`). The `+` means "one or more of the preceding element". The square brackets `[ ]` are used to specify a character class, which includes all whitespace characters (spaces, tabs, newlines) and hyphens.
